numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that people who are 15 to 24 years old are more optimistic than wise.
2. I notice that these people think that each generation is getting better.
3. I notice that older people in Brazil say that the new generation is not getting better.
4. I notice that older people in Brazil say that things are worsening.
5. I notice that older people in Mali say that the new generation is not getting better.
6. I notice that older people in Mali say that things are worsening.
7. I notice that older people in Indonesia say that each generation is getting better and better.
8. I wonder why older people have low hopes for the newer generation.
9. I wonder why older people think that the newer generation is getting worse.
10. I wonder why many people of the newer generation think that they are going to be better.
11. I wonder what would happen if younger people and older people talked.
12. I wonder why the newer generation would do better.
13. I wonder why the newer generation would do worse.
14. This relates to my community.
15. This could affect politics.
16. This could affect the economy.
17. This could affect health.
18. This could affect life in general.
19. I wonder whether older people see something that the newer generation does not see.
20. I wonder whether we are too optimistic.
21. It is hard to see both sides.
22. There might be valid reasoning for each side.
23. There might be valid meanings for each side.
24. The graph is a scatter plot.
25. The scatter plot has a line.
26. The scatter plot shows how people in a country see themselves.
27. The scatter plot shows how people in a country think future generations will be.
28. Future generations can be better.
29. Future generations can be worse.
30. The headline is: Wisdom breaks reality and optimism is hope.
